at the White House the day after Woodward and Bernstein's first story about Watergate in the Washington Post, Donald Rumsfeld asserts he defied his colleagues and demanded to get to the root of the problem, saying, If any jackass across the street[ at campaign headquarters] or here had anything to do with this, he should be hung up by his thumbs today. Donald Rumsfeld is dismissive in his attitude to Colin Powell and Rice, whose decisions he constantly criticizes.
